long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
MuseScore shows a dialogbox on opening containing the following text:
Kann Datei :/data/My_First_Score.mscz nicht lesen: Unknown error
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 2.0.2
How reproducible: allways
Steps to Reproduce: 1. launch MuseScore either from terminal with mscore or from the menu 2. observe the dialogbox with the error: "Kann Datei :/data/My_First_Score.mscz nicht lesen: Unknown error"
If the app is launched in english the error is: "Cannot read file :/data/My_First_Score.mscz: Unknown error"
3. Observe that there are no "template files" to open in the "start center" dialog.
Actual results: Confusing errors and no templates
Expected results: No confusing errors and templates
Additional info: The path seems to be hardcoded where it should be dependent on variables.

Sorry for the two mails but I missed some things that might be important:
* The Fedora has been upgraded from Fedora 23 to 24 * The message actually appears twice * In the settings the path is mentioned in "start with score" also start with score is selected. * If "start empty" is selected no error on startup. * After deleting ~/./config/MuseScore/MuseSore2.ini the file is recreated with the incorrect config value
hope that helps
mscore-2.0.3-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-94d90fbf54

mscore-2.0.3-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-94d90fbf54
mscore-2.0.3-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
